Not liking dark green veggies is also most likely an evolutionary trait for children. Dark greens contain oxalic acid which binds calcium. Before civilization and food and dairy abundance calcium was a critical scarce nutrient limiting bone density and overall growth. So it was good for prehistoric children to maximize their calcium intake by avoiding dark green vegetables.

The good thing is that your microbiome adapts to what you eat. If you eat more vegetables, you'll learn to enjoy vegetables more, since your gut's microbiome will adapt to whatever food you consume the most. This plays a lot into food cravings, as it becomes hard to quit food that one has eaten for years in the short term. However, microbiome adapt rather quickly, so it's a matter of persistence and knowing good change is to come :-)
